summary.para: Gets the resource at the current position of the enumerator.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an error code that includes, but is not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The enumerator has passed the last item in the collection.

remarks.para: The caller must free the memory allocated for resource using the function.

The enumerator returned can be empty. In this case, a call to returns false. If the enumerator is not empty, it points to the first element, and this method returns the first item. Subsequently, the user should use to move through the items, and call GetHasCurrent before using GetCurrent to access the item.

summary.para: Determines whether there is a resource at the current position of the enumerator.

param.name: hasCurrent
param.para: TRUE if the enumerator's current position references an item; FALSE if the enumerator has passed the last item in the collection.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: Advances the position of the enumerator to the next resource.

param.name: hasNext
param.para: TRUE if the enumerator successfully advances
FALSE if the enumerator has passed the end of the collection.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an error code.

Note that when the enumerator passes the end of the collection for the first time, hasNext = FALSE, but the method succeeds and returns S_OK. However, the method returns E_BOUNDS if you subsequently call another MoveNext after you have already passed the end of the collection, and you have previously received hasNext = FALSE.

summary.para: Enumerates the resources defined in the package manifest.

remarks.para: This object can be retrieved by using the method of a or object. But, starting with Windows 8.1, use IAppxManifestReader2.GetResources because it iterates over more resource qualifiers, such as, Scale and DXFeatureLevel.
